Package server.model

Class DBManager

java.lang.Object
server.model.DBManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
SQLCredentials
public class DBManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements SQLCredentials
Manages the database of everything, on the server side. Connects to the MySQL server, loads in content, and writes it back to the database.
Since:
12-04-2020
Version:
1.0
Author:
Parker Link

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from interface server.model.SQLCredentials

    DB_URL, JDBC_DRIVER, PASSWORD, USERNAME

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    DBManager()
    Creates a new database Manager.

  • Constructor Details

    • DBManager

      public DBManager()
      Creates a new database Manager. Creates a connection to the data base and reads the data in.

  • Method Details

    • initializeConnection

      public void initializeConnection()
      Initializes the connection to the MySQL database, as per the connection details defined in the SQLCredentials interface.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the connection to the MySQL database server.

    • readDatabase

      public void readDatabase()
      Reads everything from the database, compiles it (effectively syncs the database). Reads the courses, students, and registrations from scratch.

    • registerStudentInCourse

      public java.lang.String registerStudentInCourse​(Student student, CourseCatalogue cat, java.lang.String courseName, int courseNum, int courseSection)
      Adds this student to the course given by the last 3 parameters. Returns a success/error message. Adds it both locally and to the MySQL server. This method is only called from the DBController when a user adds a new course, not during setup.
      Parameters:
      student - the student to be added to the course.
      cat - the catalogue to find the course in
      courseName - the given course name
      courseNum - the given course number
      courseSection - the given course section
      Returns:
      A success/error message (gotten from the student.registerStudentInCourse) for the user

    • deleteStudentFromCourse

      public java.lang.String deleteStudentFromCourse​(Student student, CourseCatalogue cat, java.lang.String courseName, int courseNum, int courseSection)
      Deletes a registration from the specified course. Deletes it both locally and in the SQL database.
      Parameters:
      student - the student to have the registration deleted from
      cat - the catalogue to get the course from
      courseName - the name of the course
      courseNum - the course number
      courseSection - the course section
      Returns:
      Success/failure message to user

    • getStudentByID

      public Student getStudentByID​(int studentID)
      Searches the students list for a single student by their ID.
      Parameters:
      studentID - ID of Student
      Returns:
      The student, or null if not found.

    • getCourseCatalogue

      public CourseCatalogue getCourseCatalogue()
      Gets the course catalogue
      Returns:
      the CourseCatalogue

    • addCourseOffering

      public void addCourseOffering​(int courseID, java.lang.String faculty, int courseNumber, int lectNumber)
      Adds a course offering (and course) to the database.
      Parameters:
      courseID - the unique course ID
      faculty - the faculty of the course
      courseNumber - the course number
      lectNumber - the section number
